channel.title: Poem on FerrisEllis.com
channel.description: Recent content in Poem on FerrisEllis.com

item.title: Canopy
item.description: Written by Ferris Ellis on May 26th, 2018. All rights reserved. A rainless space among a storm, What you’ll wish for when the sun is too warm, A fact of a forrest, or the few we have left, Beneath it naps are aften slept.

item.title: Noise
item.description: Written by Ferris Ellis on May 17th, 2018. All rights reserved. Reach, gasp, don’t get dragged below. Minute by minute, fight the constant tow. No calm or pause to be found, in this never ending torrent, in this storm of sound. And round ‘n round, up ‘n down, tossed and turned, unable to find, peace nor mind, in this siege, of cognitive space, starved of time, a forgotten reprieve, a silenced place.
